title: Two unwanted changes within .datalad/config and datalad/.gitattributes when rerunning datalad create --force
body:
#### What is the problem?
Subsequent changes to an existing datalad dataset via datalad create --force 

1. change the dataset id
2. unnecessarily add the line ` 'metadata/aggregate* annex.largefile=nothing ` in .gitattributes again

#### What steps will reproduce the problem?

`datalad create foo`
`datalad create --force --text-no-annex foo`

`tig` shows:  

`diff --git a/.datalad/config b/.datalad/config`
`index a8b1392..a530b30 100644`
`--- a/.datalad/config`
`+++ b/.datalad/config`
`@@ -1,2 +1,2 @@`
` [datalad "dataset"]`
`-       id = 65f3c046-d6fc-11e8-9873-40a3cc1bd9a6`
`+       id = 6f267582-d6fc-11e8-bc04-40a3cc1bd9a6`
`diff --git a/.gitattributes b/.gitattributes`
`index c3aaefe..57c0a11 100644`
`--- a/.gitattributes`
`+++ b/.gitattributes`
`@@ -1,3 +1,5 @@`

` * annex.backend=MD5E`
`+**/.git* annex.largefiles=nothing`
`+* annex.largefiles=(not(mimetype=text/*))`
` **/.git* annex.largefiles=nothing`
`\ No newline at end of file`

#### What version of DataLad are you using (run `datalad --version`)? On what operating system (consider running `datalad wtf`)?

datalad 0.10.3.1.dev166

#### Is there anything else that would be useful to know in this context?

@yarikoptic please add anything that I stated unclear or wrong
